verse.roman:
bhagavann udyamo bhūyān
baler naḥ pūrva-vairiṇaḥ
aviṣahyam imaṁ manye
kenāsīt tejasorjitaḥ

synonyms: bhagavan—O my lord; udyamaḥ—enthusiasm; bhūyān—great; baleḥ—of Bali Mahārāja; naḥ—our; pūrva-vairiṇaḥ—past enemy; aviṣahyam—unbearable; imam—this; manye—I think; kena—by whom; āsīt—got; tejasā—prowess; ūrjitaḥ—achieved.
translation: My lord, our old enemy Bali Mahārāja now has new enthusiasm, and he has obtained such astonishing power that we think that perhaps we cannot resist his prowess.
